summary: Enemies search for you longer. Hide well.
descriptionHtml:
[b][u]DESCRIPTION:
[/u][/b]
This little mod does nothing more than increase the amount of time before enemy stops looking for you after you expose yourself (up to [b]30[/b] seconds) and/or attack an enemy (up to [b]90[/b] seconds). 
 
[i]Why? [/i]
Because it is more fun for you and natural for enemies to look for a possible threat longer. 
I did thorough research on existing sneak mechanic modifications by trying all of them on my heavily modded Skyrim. 
I use plenty of combat-oriented mods so, to add more "realism" feeling to game overall I needed just that, a longer "intruder alert" timer. And all of existing sneak mods are too complex for this simple task, they add too many non-vanilla, often strange mechanics and modify too many variables. 
So I got to learn a little myself and make this. 
SATT can be used in conjunction with combat mods or just to increase immersion of vanilla experience.

============================================================================================ 
[b]
[u]COMPATIBILITY:
[/u][/b]
Compatible with any mod except the ones that modify the same values (e.g. Duel - Combat Realism).

============================================================================================ 

[b][u]Mods that compliment SATT well:

[/u][/b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18436/?]ASIS[/url] by The ASIS Team - to make perks, spells and potions available to your enemies;
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/5485/?]Deadly Combat[/url] by Borgut1337 - to make fights more brutal, fast and yeah, DEADLY (complete with full MCM config menu);
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10037/?]ACE - Combat Skills[/url] by Athyra (I use Realistic Fighting module only) - to make circumstances of a fight matter;
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27866/?]High Level Enemies[/url] by Dalquist - (I prefer Hardcore version) - to make end-game enemies uhm.. exist;

[i][b][u]PS:[/u][/b] As a side note, the reduced enemy cone of vision which is implemented in many other sneak mods is unrealistic at very least (on the contrary to what these mods suggest). In-game npc cone of vision is at approximately 190 degrees and that is as realistic as it can be, it's usual human cone of vision value.[/i]
